contracts.renewal_terms: Contract is for a fixed term and will terminate at the end of the Contract Term without any further action. Prior to the end of the Contract term, the University Board shall provide a description of the process and standards by which the Academy may be considered for the issuance of a new contract. The University Board, at its sole discretion, may elect not to consider issuance of a new contract, consider reauthorization and elect not to issue a contract, or consider reauthorization and issue a contract for a fixed term.
key_terms: University Board retains 3% administrative fee from state school aid payments
University Board serves as fiscal agent and forwards state school aid funds within 3 business days

Academy must provide approved annual budget by July 1st
Academy Board minutes must be provided within 14 days of meeting
Academy may be subject to suspension, termination, or revocation for non-compliance
Transactions over $150,000 requiring payments over 1 year must be reviewed by Charter Schools Office Director 30 days prior to closing
Academy has no authority to financially obligate the State of Michigan, University Board or University
Academy Board members serve in individual capacity, not as representatives
Quorum requires majority of Academy Board members
Academy Board must meet at least 6 times per fiscal year
Specific cyber school provisions apply including limitations on new pupil enrollment and minimum instructional hours
University President may appoint a Conservator under certain circumstances
Standards for contract renewal include increases in academic achievement as most important factor

contracts.district: United States Attorney's Office for the Northern District of California
contracts.scope: Criminal penalty for conspiracy to commit honest services wire fraud through bribery of San Francisco public official Mohammed Nuru. SF Recology Group provided approximately $900,000+ in bribes including DPW holiday party payments ($60,000 total 2016-2019), Non-Profit A contributions ($150,000/year from 2014-2019), employment/internships for Nuru's son ($17,000+ direct plus $23,600 in funded internships), funeral expenses ($3,500), hotel rooms ($865.34 per room), and other benefits.
contracts.renewal_terms: Three-year term with possible extension up to one additional year at government's discretion if breach occurs
key_terms: Total criminal penalty: $36,000,000
$9,000,000 due within 60 days of filing
$9,000,000 due within 14 months of filing
$11,000,000 due within 26 months of filing
$7,000,000 to City and County of San Francisco by September 28, 2021
No tax deduction permitted for any part of fine
Cannot recover fine through surcharges, fees, or charges to customers
Three-year deferred prosecution term
Annual compliance reporting required
Full cooperation with government investigations
Charge: 18 U.S.C. § 1349 – Conspiracy to Commit Honest Services Wire Fraud
Offense level 32, Culpability score 6
Fine range under sentencing guidelines: $36,000,000 - $72,000,000
If compliant, Information will be dismissed after term completion
Statute of limitations tolled during term plus one year

contracts.scope: Collective bargaining agreement covering classified personnel (United Support Personnel/paraprofessionals) including terms and conditions of employment, wages, hours, benefits, leaves, evaluation procedures, grievance procedures, and other working conditions
contracts.renewal_terms: Contract covers period July 1, 2017 through June 30, 2020
amendments: MOU regarding Expenditure of Prop A Unallocated Revenues (June 1, 2009)
MOU regarding Expenditure of Prop A Unallocated Revenues (January 27, 2010)
Tentative Agreement for the 2010-2011 and 2011-2012 School year
Tentative Agreement for the 2012-2013 and 2013-2014 School year
Allocation of QTEA Revenue To Support Salary Increases (July 1, 2014)
Apportionment of QTEA Revenues to Support Salary Increases and Paraeducator Professional Development
key_terms: Work week consists of not more than 5 work days within 7 day period
Regular work day shall not exceed 8 hours of service
Overtime paid at 1.5 times hourly rate for hours worked beyond 40 hours per week
Holiday work paid at 1.5 times regular rate plus regular holiday pay
Minimum work assignment of 4 hours per day for newly created positions
15 minute rest periods for 4-5 hour assignments; two 15-minute rest periods for 5.5-8 hour assignments
30-60 minute unpaid lunch periods for 5+ hour assignments
Union leave provisions: 6 union members granted leaves for union business, up to 2 additional subject to qualified replacements
Agency fee required for non-union members equal to unified membership dues
Commencing 2018-2019: work year increased by 1 District Professional Development Day funded from QTEA paraeducator/paraprofessional PD (10 hours)
Vacation accrual rates vary by years of service and full year vs school term employees
Probationary period: 12 months for regular assignment, 6 months for promotive position

contracts.contract_type: Standard Form of Agreement Between Owner and Contractor - Cost Plus Fee with Guaranteed Maximum Price (AIA A102-2017)
contracts.scope: District-Wide Tornado Damage Repair Project at Berlin High School, Berlin Middle School, Cheshire Elementary and Johnny Cake Corners Elementary. All labor, services and materials needed for the repair of several District buildings damaged during recent tornados.
key_terms: Guaranteed Maximum Price (GMP) of $3,182,440.10
Construction Fee of 2.5% of Cost of Work totaling $77,620.49
General Conditions totaling $390,611.61
Contingency of $0
Substantial Completion required by August 30, 2025
Liquidated damages of $500 per day per site for failure to achieve Substantial Completion
Work procured through proposal process outside statutory bidding requirements as urgent necessity declared per Ohio Revised Code Section 3313.46
Buyout Savings retained 100% by Owner
Cost Savings retained 100% by Owner
Open Book Pricing requirements
Owner has audit rights to all Contractor records and accounts
AIA Document A201-2017 General Conditions incorporated by reference
Equipment rental charges not to exceed 100% of documented rental cost or green book rates
Contractor-owned equipment rental charges shall not exceed 50% of fair market value for change order work
All subcontracts must use State of Ohio Subcontract Form
Related party transactions require Owner's prior written authorization
Records must be preserved for three years after final payment

contracts.district: Board of School Commissioners of the City of Indianapolis
contracts.scope: Comprehensive collective bargaining agreement covering professional compensation, leaves, retirement benefits, insurance, coaching and extracurricular activities, grievance procedures, and other terms and conditions of employment for licensed teachers, social workers, guidance counselors, school psychologists, nurses, speech and language pathologists, teachers on special assignment, lead teachers, instructional coaches, and media specialists
contracts.renewal_terms: Agreement is effective July 1, 2021 through June 30, 2023
key_terms: Personal leave: 21 hours annually in one-hour increments
Sick leave: 70 hours first year, 56 hours each year thereafter, unlimited accumulation
Bereavement: Up to 5 consecutive working days within 14 calendar days
Emergency leave: Up to 35 hours sick leave conversion with committee approval
Sick leave bank: 7 hours annual contribution, $241,136 annual grant cap
Job sharing: 50% board contribution to fringe benefits
403(b) retirement plan: Until December 31, 2021 dollar-for-dollar match up to 0.5% of base salary or $105; January 1, 2022 onward 50% match up to 3% of base salary
Frozen education pay for teachers employed before October 1, 2014
26 equal pay installments annually
Group medical program with two HSA plan options
$40,000 group term life insurance with AD&D
Long-term disability coverage with maximum $90,000 annual salary covered
Dental plan with optional enhanced orthodontia coverage
Vision plan with board contribution up to $6.30 per month for employee only coverage
Employee Assistance Program with board contribution up to $2.90 per employee per month
Wellness rewards program credit up to $600 annually
COVID-19 vaccination stipend up to $300
Grievance procedure with two-step process and 20-day filing deadline

Teachers excluded from collective bargaining unit: employees at Arlington Middle School (except social workers, media specialists, special education teachers), innovative network school employees, administrators, supervisors, confidential employees, security employees
Teacher assault protection: reimbursement for damaged personal property and no leave charged for injury-related absences
Emergency school closing: full pay for all teachers
Summer school hourly rate plus optional stipends up to $3,000 based on fund availability
Transformation zone and emerging schools: discretionary stipend payments
Opportunity Culture roles with stipends ranging from $1,300 to $18,300
Head varsity coach consecutive year bonus up to $500 per year (capped at $2,500)

contracts.district: Portland Board of Public Education of the City of Portland
contracts.scope: Collective bargaining agreement covering Educational Technicians I, II, and III including wages, benefits, working conditions, leaves, holidays, professional development, evaluation, discipline, layoff procedures, and other terms and conditions of employment for educational technician staff
contracts.renewal_terms: Three-year agreement with defined wage scales for each year
key_terms: Sick leave accrual: 15 days per school year, accumulative to 180 days

Paid holidays: Indigenous Peoples' Day, Veterans Day, Thanksgiving, Day after Thanksgiving, Christmas, Memorial Day, New Year's Day, MLK Jr. Day, Presidents Day, Patriots Day, Labor Day, July 4 (year-round), Juneteenth (if scheduled)
Vacation days: 10 days per year, increasing after 10 years of service
Personal leave: 3 days per year, deducted from sick leave
Bereavement: Up to 10 days for spouse/partner/child, 5 days for parents/grandparents/in-laws/grandchildren/siblings, 3 days for other relatives
Health insurance: 100% single/single adult with children, 75% two-person, 82% full family for Choice Plus plan
Dental insurance: 100% of single subscriber Delta Dental Plan III
Work year: Student school year plus 5 additional workdays (effective 2023-24)
Regular work day: 7.5 hours including 0.5 hour unpaid lunch
Overtime: 1.5x pay for hours over 40 in a workweek
Probationary period: 24 calendar months from date of hire
Discipline: Just Cause required after probation
Layoffs by seniority within impact areas and job classifications
Retirement benefit: Per diem pay for up to 60 unused sick leave days after 10 years service
Educational improvement: Reimbursement for 6 credit hours per year at USM rates
Professional development: Minimum 10 hours annually
Earned Paid Leave: First 40 hours of paid leave may be used in 1-hour increments
Parties agree to split payroll taxes for Maine Paid Family Medical Leave Act
Ed Tech Association President receives $12,000 annual stipend for orientation, professional development planning, and HR collaboration
